In general, we cannot control when clients will cause the breakpoint manager to 
retrieve its breakpoints.

If a resource change triggers breakpoints to be restored, and restoring 
breakpoints causes a resource modification, there is trouble. Suggest turning 
off resource delta processing if the manager has not yet restored breakpoints. 
Need to determine if there is a case where this could be invalid.

For example, is it possible to remove a (registerd) breakpoint before 
breakpoints have been restored?

Fixed. I think it is theoretically possible for a plug-in to try to remove a 
registered breakpoint before the manager has loaded breakpoints, but in 
practive it would be very difficult.

Removed the flag checking if the BreakpointManager was deleting non persited 
breakpoints as this will be handled by the same check in resourceChanged.
Verified.
